description: Short period primes: the decimal expansion of 1/p has period less than p-1, but greater than zero.
comments: Primes 2 and 5 are excluded because 1/2 and 1/5 have no period. Also primes p whose multiplicative order mod p is less than p-1.
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
prog: (PARI) a(n)=gcd(n,10)==1 && isprime(n) && znorder(Mod(10,n))<n-1 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 15 2014
